reviews.text:
Lovely little stop with machine and polite and helpful manned booth, a local cafe and toilets. 

Cons- Toilets are very dated (but usually clean), no phone signal and the ticket machine and manned booth both keep irregular hours (former breaks down a fair bit and the latter seems to be on part time hours)

Lovely small village station. Heavily involved in the community. One little ticket office and an outdoor ticket machine. Platforms are covered so all good if you have a wait in bad weather. Bike stands and a free bike pump. Lovely little community run coffee shop too. Staff are very helpful - I buy my monthly season ticket there having been fobbed off by staff at Exeter that it was only possible online. Few clicks and details and all sorted in Yatton. Hard to knock!
The signal’s dead but it’s cute
A lovely traditional historic railway station on the Great Western Main Line. HSTs pass through daily and steam trains pass through weekly in the Summer.
